intro: Bilabrella ichneumonea, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. It has a fibrous root system and produces capsule fruits containing numerous small seeds. Bilabrella ichneumonea is sometimes considered a weed due to its rapid growth and ability to spread easily.
